newsitem.title: USA: Centerior Perry nuke seen at full power Weds.
newsitem.headline: Centerior Perry nuke seen at full power Weds.

text.p: Centerior Energy Corp's 1,205 megawatt Perry 1 nuclear power plant should reach full production late Wednesday after cutting output for a steam condensor leak, a company spokesman said.
"We're bringing it back up now. We are currently at 92 percent," spokesman Jim Sielicki said Wednesday.
The North Perry, Ohio, unit was reduced to 60 percent power Tuesday when the leak was detected, Sielicki said.
The leak was not detected at the lower power level and has not resurfaced as the unit has been boosting power, eliminating the need for repairs, the spokesman said.
